sub_title: First vice president UIHJ (International Union of Judicial Officers); Legal reform; Legal and institutional capacity building; Legal drafting; Enforcement; Training, including train the trainer programs;
summary:
Legal drafting, capacity building, institution building, international relations
Training activities (Train the Trainers; Training Needs Assessment; curricula development; management); 
Management (> 20 years) in commercial companies (>75 FTE) 
Management NGO's (> 10 year of experience, international professional organizations, board member, member board of trustees a.o.)
Judicial officer (Gerechtsdeurwaarder) (> 20 years)
Lecturer university (bachelor, LLM programs), judicial academies (> 15 years)

15 years experience as international adviser, Rule of law projects, legal reform projects, legal drafting, EU acquis, human rights, regional cooperation:
      - senior expert with proven professional experience in particular civil justice, court
        administration, judicial reform, justice administration, reinforcement of the rule of law, human
        rights, capacity and institution building, enforcement law, ethics, disciplinary proceedings, E 
        justice
      - Institution building
      - Legal drafting: civil law, civil procedure law, enforcement law, bylaws and regulations for legal 
        professionals
      - Project management in both country projects and regional projects
      - Assessment: legal systems, judiciary
      - Public legal awareness: information, communication, general public, other legal professionals
      - Media relations: radio, newspapers, television
      - Development of quality management systems, monitoring and control systems
      - Development business models for legal professionals
      - Evaluation and assessment of legal systems in particular in the field of civil justice, capacity
        building, case management
      - Experience in multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary project teams
      - Experience in regional (multilateral) cooperation
      - Experience as senior expert in different EU (incl., Taiex, Tacis, Cards, Twinning), USAID, 
        Council  of Europe, IMF, World bank, other funded programs

profile_positions.title: Team Lead Manager
Project Manager Privacy Awareness in Civil Enforcement (PACE) project

profile_positions.description: The project aims to cover the existing information gap on enforcement procedures, requirements, competence, costs and timing in the EU-28 MS (29 enforcement systems). Specifically: collect accurate information on enforcement legislation, procedures, expenses and professionals across EU enforcement systems; compile, present and compare this information in a user-friendly and accessible way; make this information accessible online through the EU Enforcement Atlas and integrate it with the EU judicial atlas.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Enforcement Atlas Project

profile_positions.description:
Support institutional development for the free legal professions in Kosovo; review and analysis legal framework.
Training of Trainers for notaries, mediators, private enforcement agents and bankruptcy administrators.
profile_positions.title: Legal and Institutional Capacity Building Senior ST Expert

profile_positions.description:
Project ENABLE (Enabling Dematerialised Access to Information and Assets for Judicial Enforcement of claims in the European Union)
The project aims to explore e-justice solutions for dematerialized exchanges and pragmatic conditions for secure access to and exchange of information for enforcement in the EU MS. Specifically to make an inventory of procedures, systems, e-justice practices and solutions; assess the interoperability and compatibility of national systems; assess the electronic access to debtor registration systems; identify bottlenecks and good practices; enable cross country exchange; propose alternative scenarios for coordinating existing systems to ensure compatible solutions; propose technical specifications and architecture of supporting systems; assess the impact and cost of these solutions. (Participating countries: Netherlands, Belgium, Portugal, Greece, Bulgaria, Estonia, Lithuania, Latvia)
profile_positions.title: Project Manager ENABLE Project (E-Justice)

profile_positions.description: Expert in the twinning project to provide support to the Judicial Academy in Croatia in (1) updating and development of EU law modules and materials (civil, commercial and criminal law), including relevant training of the trainers(2) assistance in preparation of the comprehensive EU law curriculum for judiciary and upgrade and improvement of the judicial training system and enhancement of the lifelong learning system, (3) enhancement of professionalism and competences of the Croatian judiciary and integration of EU law in national law through training.
profile_positions.title: Senior Expert: Support Judicial Academy in development EU law modules and materials; ToT for Judges

profile_positions.description:
Project Strengthening the Judicial Cooperation in Civil and Criminal Matters: the overall objective of this project is the consolidation of the rule of law in the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia through improved implementation of international and European Union standards and recommendations in the areas of freedom, security, justice and respect of human rights. 
Activities: strengthen the capacities of the Department for international legal assistance in Ministry of Justice, Courts and competent  stakeholders involved in mutual legal assistance (MLA) regarding the implementation of the international and European Union standards (review existing laws and regulations, development manuals, Advice on institutional framework and coordination mechanisms between relevant institutions and implementation of the legal framework in the international cooperation in criminal and civil matters, strengthening administrative and management capacities of the officials  from the Department for international legal assistance, enhance the internal communication between relevant institutions to international judicial cooperation.
profile_positions.title: Capacity building and legal drafting expert

profile_positions.description:
Legal (key) expert in various Rule of Law projects supported by World bank, IMF, USAID/ European Union/ Council of Europe: Albania, Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Estonia,  FYR Macedonia, Georgia, Kosovo, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldova, Montenegro, Russia, Serbia, Slovenia, Turkey, Ukraine

(legal drafting, capacity building, institution building, legal training, lecturer)
profile_positions.title: Legal (key) expert various Rule of Law, legal reform and commercial law projects

profile_positions.description: Strengthening civil enforcement in the Western Balkan region (Albania, Serbia, Kosovo, Montenegro and Northern Macedonia) with a focus on cross border enforcement and monitoring and control
profile_positions.title: Lead Expert Balkan Enforcement Strengthening Project (BESP)

profile_positions.description: Commercial Justice Activity Program. The Program aims to reduce opportunities for corruption and encourage investment in Kosovo by helping to improve the resolution of commercial disputes and the enforcement of judgements. One of the Program’s core activities is to support improvement in the transparency, accountability, and professionalism of Kosovo’s Private Enforcement System. The profession continues to develop and needs additional assistance to ensure that it continues contributing to public confidence in the judicial system. This engagement will initiate the Program’ assistance with the MOJ to strengthen supervision and disciplinary processes over private enforcement profession and to build capacity of the Chamber of Private Enforcement Agents.
profile_positions.title: Senior enforcement expert

profile_positions.description: In the Internet age, the nature of property and the methods of communication have changed dramatically. Yet, so far, hardly any legislation is available with regard to a person’s digital assets (such as computer files, web domains, digital currency and social media accounts). As in the USA and Canada, also within the European legal environment there is a need to introduce rules with regard to such digital assets. European citizens need to be able to manage and plan the disposition of their digital property (e.g. in case of death). In case of absence of such planning, rules should apply. The project focuses on the drafting of a European legislative instrument.
profile_positions.title: Co-reporter project Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets

profile_positions.description: Analyses against the background of Council of Europe standards and case-law of the European Court on Human Rights the legislation of Ukraine in the field of enforcement; elaborate the compliance of such legislation with international standards; suggestions on the use of IT in the field of enforcement.

profile_positions.description:
Depository Network is the world`s first multi-platform network enable lenders (P2P lending marketplaces, banks, other credit institutions) to accept digital assets as collateral.

By building and spreading the DEPO multi-platform network globally, our aim is to reach a tipping point for mass adoption of using blockchain assets in traditional lending.
profile_positions.title: Member Advisory Council
